summary: This document details the activities of an unnamed associate (referred to as "she" or "her") who, between approximately 2002 and 2005, scheduled hundreds of massage appointments for Jeffrey Epstein at the direction of Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The associate facilitated appointments for dozens of minor victims, during which Epstein sexually abused them. The document also describes the associate's actions in 2005 to contact victims and discourage them from cooperating with law enforcement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexually abusing dozens of minor victims during massage appointments that were scheduled for him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Provided a directory of contacts and directed the scheduling of massage appointments for Epstein alongside him.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein jointly directed the scheduling associate, with Maxwell providing the initial directory of contacts for massage appointments.
The associate was hired by Epstein and carried out tasks at his direction, including scheduling appointments and later contacting victims.
The associate received directions and resources (a directory) from Maxwell to schedule appointments for Epstein.
Epstein sexually abused dozens of minor victims during the massage appointments that were scheduled for him.
The associate scheduled appointments, met victims, arranged transportation, and paid them, thereby facilitating their access to Epstein.

events.title: Scheduling and Facilitation of Massage Appointments
events.description: An associate scheduled hundreds of massage appointments for Jeffrey Epstein, involving dozens of minor victims, at his residences in Palm Beach, Florida, and New York, New York.

events.title: Sexual Abuse of Minors
events.description: During scheduled massage appointments, Epstein sexually abused dozens of minor victims through various acts including masturbation, genital touching, use of sex toys, oral sex, and sexual intercourse.

events.title: Associate Contacts Victims After Investigation Revealed
events.description: After learning of a law enforcement investigation into Epstein, the associate, at Epstein's direction, called multiple minor victims to encourage them to 'help' Epstein, offered to pay for an attorney, and in some cases offered financial incentives, with the intent to dissuade them from speaking to law enforcement.

events.title: Federal Investigation Interviews Begin
events.description: Multiple minor victims were interviewed by federal law enforcement officers as part of a criminal investigation into Epstein and his associates for sex trafficking of minors.

locations: Epstein's residence in Palm Beach, Florida
Epstein's residence in New York, New York
keyFacts: An associate scheduled hundreds of massage appointments for Jeffrey Epstein between 2002 and 2005, involving dozens of minor victims aged 14 to 17.

Epstein sexually abused these minor victims during the massage appointments at his residences, with the abuse including masturbation, genital touching, use of sex toys, oral sex, and sexual intercourse.
The associate, at Epstein's direction, took nude or partially nude photographs of one minor victim, though Epstein was not present.
In 2005, after learning of the law enforcement investigation, the associate called victims at Epstein's direction to discourage them from cooperating, offering legal and financial incentives.
The associate denies participating in or witnessing any abuse, suggesting victims may have mistaken her for another person.
